org.fluidity.foundation

Class Exceptions.Tunnel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.Exceptions.Tunnel
  • Enclosing class:
    Exceptions

    public static final class Exceptions.Tunnel
extends Object
    Implements the actual exception wrapping / unwrapping functionality described at Exceptions.

    Usage

    See Exceptions, substituting an instance of this class acquired through Exceptions.checked() in place of Exceptions in the static method call Exceptions.wrap(â€¦).
    See Also:
    Exceptions.checked(Class[])

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public <R,E extends Exception,T extends Exception> R wrap(Class<T> wrapper,
                                                          Command.Process<R,E> command)
                                                   throws T extends Exception
        Executes the given command and wraps any exception thrown therefrom.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the command.
        E - the type of the exception thrown by the command.
        T - the type of the exception to wrap with.
        Parameters:
        wrapper - the exception class to use to wrap the exception thrown by the command; may be null, in which case Exceptions.Wrapper will be used.
        command - the command to execute.
        Returns:
        whatever the given command returns.
        Throws:
        T - as thrown by the command.
        T extends Exception

      • wrap

        public <R,E extends Exception> R wrap(Command.Process<R,E> command)
        Executes the given command and wraps any exception thrown therefrom.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the command.
        E - the type of the exception thrown by the command.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to execute.
        Returns:
        whatever the given command returns.

      • wrap

        public <R,E extends Exception> R wrap(Object label,
                                      Command.Process<R,E> command)
        Executes the given command and wraps any exception other than RuntimeException and Error thrown therefrom.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the command.
        E - the type of the exception thrown by the command.
        Parameters:
        label - the error message in the wrapped exception; use Deferred.Labels to defer computing the label.
        command - the command to run.
        Returns:
        whatever the command returns.

      • wrap

        public <R,E extends Exception,T extends Exception> R wrap(Object label,
                                                          Class<T> wrapper,
                                                          Command.Process<R,E> command)
                                                   throws T extends Exception
        Executes the given command and wraps any exception other than RuntimeException and Error thrown therefrom.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the command.
        E - the type of the exception thrown by the command.
        T - the type of the exception to wrap with.
        Parameters:
        label - the error message in the wrapped exception; use Deferred.Labels to defer computing the label.
        wrapper - the exception class to use to wrap the exception thrown by the command; may be null, in which case Exceptions.Wrapper will be used.
        command - the command to run.
        Returns:
        whatever the command returns.
        Throws:
        T - as thrown by the command.
        T extends Exception

      • unwrap

        public Throwable unwrap(Exception error)
        Unwraps a chain of exception wrappers from the head of the exception chain starting at the specified error. Exceptions recognized as wrappers are:
        • any subclass of UndeclaredThrowableException,
        • any subclass of InvocationTargetException,
        • any subclass of PrivilegedActionException,
        • any subclass of any exception type passed to Exceptions.checked(Class[]),
        • RuntimeException,
        • Exceptions.Wrapper.
        Parameters:
        error - the head of the exception chain to unwrap.
        Returns:
        the first non-wrapper exception in the chain.
